ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription:
How many hours of paid employment did you work in your last full 
week of work?
About how many hours per week would you prefer to work?
Do the number of hours you work stay nearly the same every week, or vary from week  to week?
Notes: 1= Stay nearly the same every week; 2= Vary from week to week

ElementDescription: If works for someone else, How long have you worked for you present primary employer?
What is the job title of your primary job, that is, the job at which you spend the most hours per week?
From the following list of occupations, how would you classify your primary job, that is, the job at which you spend the most hours per week?
Notes: Professional or technical;  Executive, managerial or administrative;  Marketing and sales;  Administrative support, including clerical;  Service;  Skilled crafts;  Construction;  Production;  Transportation or material moving; Handler, equipment cleaner, helper, laborer; Other

ElementDescription: Are you sometimes able to do your regularly scheduled work at home?
On average, how many hours per week do you work at home?
Which type of work schedule best describes your work situation?
Notes: 1= Standard full time; 2= Flexible work hours; 3= Compressed work week; 4= Job sharing; 5= Other part time

ElementDescription: Which is the best way of describing your job shift?
Notes: 1= Days; 2= Swing/ evening; 3= Nights; 4= Rotating; 5= Weekend only; 6= Other

ElementDescription: Do you usually work Saturdays or Sundays as part of your scheduled work?
What is the amount of time it usually takes you to travel one way from home to work?
